Publishing the Bill on Thursday, Mr Michael Gove said: There are areas of Ofsted inspections, such as community cohesion or regulations governing what students bring in in their lunchboxes at lunchtime, which are entirely peripheral. "One of the problems with Ofsted inspections is that they are asked to inspect and measure for things which, by definition, are hard to judge and not central to what schools are about. The Bill hands more control to the Education Secretary to intervene in failing schools. Mr Michael Gove insisted that under-achieving academies will not be exempt from this. The surprise shake-up announced Thursday appears to be driven by Eric Schmidt 's desire to assume more of a behind-the-scenes role as much as Page's personal ambition. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt wrote on his Twitter account moments after Google dropped the bombshell that upstaged its fourth-quarter earnings. Eric Schmidt , 55, will still be available to advise Page, 37, and Google's other 37-year-old founder, Sergey Brin

GigaOm writes. On a more practical note, "Google's change could be designed to erase memories of some awkward statements made recently by its outgoing CEO," writes CNNMoney.com. Eric Schmidt 's public image took some hits after a string of verbal gaffes. Notoriously, on CNN's "Parker Spitzer," Eric Schmidt recently suggested that people who are uneasy about their properties showing up on Google Street View should move.
